text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
adventuretime cake pop tutorial but
today I'm going to be showing you how to
make Jake and Finn from adventure time I
have had so many requests from you guys
do something adventure time so this is
what I've come up with I hope I've
managed to do your Brad and if you love
it make sure you give a like and give it
a share today I've teamed up with the
lovely Jackie over at nerdy crafty
YouTube channel she's got a tutorial
that shows you how to make these
stunning adventure time polymer clay
earrings she's giving away a couple of
skirts on her channel so I will link to

to be giving away in the April monthly

if you want to get your hands on a free

will need to make your adventuretime
cakepops I'm resting my pops in a
polystyrene block today I've also got
some wax paper and a couple of ziplock
bags I've got my cake pops ready to go
so if you don't have a great cake pop
recipe I will leave a link to ours in
the description box below I've got two
here that I'm going to show you how to
shape and - they've already pre shaped
and pre firmed just to make a tutorial a
bit faster today the melzar chocolate in
wine yellow kind of a fleshy color or
skin color and I put some black candy
melt but a little bit of water and some
really small fine plain white sprinkles
or nonpareils
some larger white sprinkles these are
often called confetti or sequins and
these are about three millimeter in
diameter I've also got some plain Tic
Tacs a couple of paper straws in blue
and black as well as some lollipop
sticks a pair of scissors and some
toothpicks so let's get started the
first thing you want to do is you want
to shape your cake pop balls so these
two here are pre shaped and really
they're just a couple of different ovals
but you want to take your soft made
cakepop ball and I'm just going to roll
it in between my hands to make the shape
for Jake's head now for Jake said it
should be slightly fatter at the bottom
than what it is at the top but I've
learned that it's really just kind of
like an oval or an edgy type shape for
Finn's head you want to use the same
technique just rolling it into a bit of
an oval but you want to use your finger
just to kind of Pat it down on the front
because you want it to be a little bit
flatter you want the top of Finn's head
to be slightly wider than the bottom so
across the top and across the bottom it
kind of tapers down into a bit of a chin
shape pop them both off into the fridge
and let them completely set and when you
come back there should be really nice
and firm take Jake's head now and you
want to just dip your lollipop stick
into some of the
melted yellow chocolate or candy melts
and insert it about half to
three-quarters of the way up your cake
pop you can see here I've got a little
crack in my cake pop if this happens to
you and it's fairly common you want to
just take a little bit of extra melted
chocolate and use a toothpick or
something just to seal in the crap
here's just fills in the crack and it
stops it from cracking once you apply
your top coat while the yellow
chocolates still wet take your black and
white straw and slide it all the way up
the stick into the chocolate which is
going to act like a glue to glue it to
our pop just the same with our Finn you
want to dip your lollipop stick into
your white chocolate and slide it up
into kind of the skinnier end or the
smaller chin end of Finn's head sliding
it in about half way and then you want
to take that blue white straw slide it
up into that wet chocolate seal and glue
it on let those two completely set
once it's set you can take your fin and
you want to take those tic tacs and just
dip them ever so slightly into your
white chocolate and then stick them you
can create with them a little bit you
want them to go about one millimeter or
so into the actual cake pop the white
shot that's going to act like a glue and
stop them from falling off when you
actually dip but there's going to look
like Finn's little ears take one of your
ziplock bags now and you want to fill up
with some of that yellow chocolate or
candy melt and just snip off a very fine
tip to make like a little piping bag and
then you want to do it's really hard to
describe these shows but you just paint
the shapes of Jake's kind of like his
muzzle I guess onto some baking paper
and then two little ovals for his little
ears you want to exactly the sand with
your flesh or skin toned colored
chocolate or candy melts and you just
want to paint it's kind of like a bit of
a TV screen sort of a shape so sort of
like a rounded edge rectangle for the
front of Finn's face pop those ones off
into the fridge and let them completely
set and when we bring them back you want
to use the flat side that's actually
been on the wax paper because that's
going to be the really neat side so
taking Finn now you want to dip him into
that melted white chocolate dip him all
the way down and give him a good tap off
I like to tap on one side and then turn
onto the other so that I'm sort of
forcing the chocolate down in between
his ears and not losing any of that
shape once you're happy that you've got
most of the excess off but he's not dry
yet take his little skin colored face
and stick it straight on front-row
Center
pop him off to the side and let that
white coat completely dry you can take
Jake now and you want to
him exactly the same into you a yellow
candy melt holding out give him a little
tap off once again
don't let him dry too much here so just
tap off whatever excess you can but work
them quite quickly you want to stick on
kind of his little muzzle and then you
want to stick his two little ears on
either side sticking out a little bit
you don't want them to be too close to
the sides of his head again that can go
up into your polystyrene block to
completely set now for your detailing
you want to take a toothpick and some of
that black candy melt Jake's gonna get
like a little tongue and a little nose
and then if you get too large black
candy melts circles so I put like a
little dot to make sure that I'm happy
with where they're both going to go but
you want to work on one first and you
want to make sure you've got quite a
good amount of candy melt on there then
take one of your white larger sprinkles
and stick it in the middle this kind of
looks like his little glasses but he
still gets that nice little black
outline around it without you having to
do any really fine piping here repeat
that with your second eye and that is
essentially your Jake Adventure Time
cake pop ready to go because we've added
these straws after the fact they're a
little bit longer so I like to snip off
the last inch or so just so they're a
regular cake pop hi heading off into the
polystyrene block and we'll finish up
our Finn for Finn's mouth he's just
going to get like a little half circle
you want to work relatively quickly here
so draw the little half circle using
that toothpick and then you want to take
your other toothpicks out clean one dip
it into your water and then dip it into
those little white sprinkles the water's
going to help you to pick up the
sprinkles but I'm just putting five tiny
little sprinkles down in that melted
black candy melt to give him like his
little gap to smile take your black
candy melt in and that toothpick and he
just simply gets two little dots spread
quite far apart for his eyes
that's your Finn Adventure Time cake pop
also ready to go slipping the end off
that cake pop stick once again and
you've got your two gorgeous little
adventuretime cake pops
ready for your Adventure Time themed
